document.discussion_title: Columbia To Host 2017 SAL All-Star Game | wltx.com
document.topic_text: Close Columbia To Host 2017 SAL All-Star Game Columbia will host the 2017 South Atlantic League All-Star Game. That announcement coming on the night the team accepts the Ball Park of the Year Award. Reggie Anderson, wltx 10:53 PM. EST August 11, 2016 Spirit Communications Park will host the 2017 South Atlantic League All-Star Game. It will mark the first time since 1992 the Midlands has hosted the best players of the SAL. (Photo: Anderson, Reggie) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN GOOGLE+ PINTEREST COLUMBIA, SC - For the first time since 1992, Columbia is hosting the South Atlantic League All-Star Game. Spirit Communications Park will be the site of the 2017 event, the team announced Thursday night during the Columbia Fireflies' game with Greensboro. The announcement came one inning after team officials formally accepted the 2016 "Ball Park of the Year" Award from Ball Park Digest. The All-Star game will be played June 20, 2017 with a home run derby, fan fest, all-star gala and other events taking place during All-Star week. That 1992 SAL All-Star Game at Capital City Stadium saw former Yankees pitcher and ALCS MVP Andy Pettite make an appearance. Recently, the SAL All-Star Game has seen the likes of Bryce Harper and Madson Bumgarner come through along with Hall of Famers Tom Glavine, Nolan Ryan, Ryne Sandberg and Steve Carlton.
